meanings.definition: Having more beef or muscle mass.
meanings.sent1: The wrestler looked beefier after months of training.
meanings.sent2: The bodybuilder wanted to become beefier by lifting heavier weights.
meanings.sent3: The little dog tried to act beefier by barking loudly at the mailman.
meanings.sent4: Her car, though small, felt beefier on the road after the engine upgrade.
meanings.sent5: The steak on the grill smelled even beefier than usual, making everyone's mouths water.

meanings.definition: To make something more substantial or stronger.
meanings.sent1: He decided to beefier his argument by adding more evidence.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers needed to beefier the foundation to support the new building.
meanings.sent3: She tried to beefier her cake recipe by adding extra vanilla extract.
meanings.sent4: The coach wanted to beefier the team's defense before the big game.
meanings.sent5: The company aimed to beefier its presence in the market by launching a new advertising campaign.
